formal_accuser.name: Procureur for Chapter of St Dié

confession.devil_appearance: man in black with a hideous face
confession.seduction_context: After court dispute with Claudon Jacot Henry who called her witch and said she had 'enfanté son marit pour l'avoir en mariage'. She went to collect wood and met the devil who promised revenge if she would renounce God

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused asked his wife for cheese, he forbade it due to her reputation
Her horse damaged his field of oats

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 2 days after Françatte looked at her with hideous eye

testimony.quarrel_subject: His pigs damaged her garden; also refused to let his horse service her mare; also straying animals
Asked for milk, wife refused; also his father did not consent to her marriage to his brother

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after father refused to consent to marriage

witnesses.name: Mengeatte fille Michiel Jean le Masson

testimony.quarrel_subject: Asked for plate of soup at brother Clement Masson's house, none to give

witnesses.name: Zabel fille Jean de la Dague

testimony.quarrel_subject: Françatte habitually asked to borrow necessities, often refused
Refused to lend her a horse for ploughing
Left her service after 9 weeks due to constant illness
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle luy prioit de ne parler de son faict et que jamais elle ne luy feroit mal

testimony.quarrel_subject: Valencin Connemant reported her to gruyer for cutting more wood than paid for
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il luy avoit faict ce plaisir la mais qu'elle luy en rendroit un aultre, qui viendroit bien a aultant de desplaisir

testimony.quarrel_subject: Agreed to buy horse, cow, and other animals but her procureurs would not agree; he was angry
Asked for loan of horse-comb, he refused but offered to sell one; also refused loan of mallet

witnesses.name: Agatte veuve Jean de la Dague

testimony.quarrel_subject: Every time they refused her something
Lent her horses, then asked for loan of her horses, she refused
Took her son into service but sent him home as unsuitable

timeline.subject: Françatte veuve Claudon Jardel
timeline.details: At request of procureur for Chapter of St Dié

timeline.subject: Françatte veuve Claudon Jardel
timeline.details: Denied charges, admitted reputation and some quarrels

timeline.subject: Françatte veuve Claudon Jardel
timeline.details: Made no reproaches except saying witnesses lied like thieves

timeline.subject: Françatte veuve Claudon Jardel
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to torture

timeline.subject: Françatte veuve Claudon Jardel
timeline.details: Withstood thumbscrews but confessed when racked

timeline.subject: Françatte veuve Claudon Jardel
timeline.details: Repeated earlier confessions and added details

timeline.subject: Françatte veuve Claudon Jardel
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees, subject to final repetition of confessions

timeline.subject: Françatte veuve Claudon Jardel
timeline.details: Final confession that all earlier avowals were true

torture.requesting_official: Procureur for Chapter of St Dié

accomplices_named.name: Didier Ferry alias de la Maixe
Colatte femme Jean de la Fangue
Colas de la Senec le vieux

prior_accusations.context: Called her witch and said she had 'enfanté son marit pour l'avoir en mariage'; they went to court where only he was obliged to make reparation

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Jacot Henry
notable_quotes.french: enfanté son marit pour l'avoir en mariage
notable_quotes.context: Accusation that she had bewitched her husband to marry her

notable_quotes.speaker: Pierron Jean le Masson (witness 3) about Françatte
notable_quotes.english: looking at her with a hideous eye
notable_quotes.context: How Françatte looked at his wife before she fell ill and died

notable_quotes.speaker: Claude Vincent (witness 11), Françatte's words
notable_quotes.english: that he would gain nothing from it
notable_quotes.context: Threat after he refused to lend her a horse

notable_quotes.speaker: Claude Orbain (witness 12), Françatte's words
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle luy prioit de ne parler de son faict et que jamais elle ne luy feroit mal
notable_quotes.english: that she begged him not to speak of her deeds and that she would never harm him
notable_quotes.context: When he left her service due to illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Blaisatte femme Colas le Masson (witness 13), Françatte's words
notable_quotes.french: qu'il luy avoit faict ce plaisir la mais qu'elle luy en rendroit un aultre, qui viendroit bien a aultant de desplaisir
notable_quotes.english: that he had done her that favor but she would return another that would amount to as much displeasure
notable_quotes.context: Threat against Valencin Connemant after he reported her for cutting too much wood

notable_quotes.speaker: Blaisatte femme Colas le Masson (witness 13), Françatte's words
notable_quotes.french: qu'il s'en aille au bois et qu'il y trouveroit les gruyeres de Frasse... allez allez au bois
notable_quotes.english: that he should go to the woods and he would find the foresters of Fraisse there... go go to the woods
notable_quotes.context: Words spoken to Valencin Connemant before he fell violently ill and died

notable_quotes.speaker: Pierron Voignier (witness 16)
notable_quotes.french: et disoit on communement qu'elle avoit faict mourir son marit, et l'avoit icelle sy bien en amouraché par (il n'en scait quelz moyens) abusé qu'il estoit contrainct l'espouser, et ne pouvoit durer ny arrester en place qu'il ne la voye, touttefois a la remonstrance de ses plus familiers amys qui luy mectoient au devant le crime de sortilleges dont elle en estoit prevenue, il s'en depetra
notable_quotes.english: and it was commonly said that she had caused her husband to die, and had so bewitched him (by what means he did not know) and abused him that he was forced to marry her, and could not endure or stay anywhere without seeing her, however at the remonstrance of his closest friends who put before him the crime of witchcraft of which she was accused, he freed himself
notable_quotes.context: Reputation that she had bewitched her husband into marriage

notable_quotes.speaker: Zabel fille Jean de la Dague (witness 10)
notable_quotes.french: estoit fort coustumiere d'aller a leur losgis demander d'emprung ce qu'elle avoit de necessité et comme souvent ilz la refusoient de ce qu'elle demandoit, aussy tost ils perdoient tantost une vache, ung porc, ou quelque aultre bestial
notable_quotes.english: was very accustomed to going to their dwelling to ask to borrow what she needed and as they often refused what she asked for, immediately they lost now a cow, a pig, or some other livestock
notable_quotes.context: Pattern of requesting items and animal deaths following refusals

notable_quotes.speaker: Françatte veuve Claudon Jardel (about husband)
notable_quotes.english: the best man in the world
notable_quotes.context: Her defense against accusation of killing her husband

notable_quotes.speaker: Françatte veuve Claudon Jardel
notable_quotes.french: mais que l'on luy mest des grandes affaires sur elle
notable_quotes.english: but that great matters were placed upon her
notable_quotes.context: Her response about living with neighbors

relationships.evidence_text: Françatte veuve Claudon Jardel; married Claudon Colas Jardel, who had died some 10 years earlier
Said she was about 50, daughter of Colas de la Heutte
daughter of Colas de la Heutte and his wife Yzabel of Plumieres
Was sure she had killed his father Colas Demenge du Vic, who had not consented to her marriage with his brother
36 years earlier had gone into service with Humbert Herquel at Plainfain, for 4 years
then 5 years with Ferry Jean Ferry at Clemecey
Some 6 or 7 years before had been in her service, but left after 9 weeks
15 years before had been in her service for 5 years
Was sure she had killed his father Colas Demenge du Vic

relationships.person1: Mengeatte fille Michiel Jean le Masson
relationships.evidence_text: she had asked for a plate of soup at house of her brother Clement Masson
Agatte veuve Jean de la Dague

relationships.person1: Zabel fille Jean de la Dague
relationships.evidence_text: Zabel fille Jean de la Dague
Anthoine Claudel, who lived with her

harms_catalog.method_alleged: devil Navel made felled tree fall on horse (confession)

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: His pigs damaged her garden; he called her witch

harms_catalog.harm_description: horse died immediately
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refused to let his horse service her mare

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel over straying animals

harms_catalog.harm_description: death
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Did not consent to her marriage with his brother, did not attend marriage feast

harms_catalog.harm_description: ox sickened, then began to recover after she was told to cure it
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Came asking for milk, wife refused, he told her off

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost cow
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel 7 years earlier
harms_catalog.method_alleged: putting powder in water it was drinking (confession)

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost some piglets
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel 7 years earlier

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, lost use of hand
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Asked for plate of soup, none to give
harms_catalog.method_alleged: touched arm with powder between fingers (confession)

harms_catalog.harm_description: cow lost milk
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel with her

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost cow, pig, or other livestock
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Habitually asked to borrow necessities, often refused

harms_catalog.harm_description: cow sickened with legs rotting, became rabid, had to kill it
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refused to lend her a horse for ploughing; she was angry

harms_catalog.harm_description: constantly unwell during 9 weeks of service
taken with violent sickness outside village, died in a week
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Reported her to gruyer for cutting more wood than paid for
harms_catalog.method_alleged: devil agreed to go to woods and terrify him so he died (confession)

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill, recovered in a week after threatening to have her burned
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute over purchase of animals; he was angry

harms_catalog.harm_description: goat started to cry strangely, died next morning
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Asked for loan of horse-comb, he refused but offered to sell one

harms_catalog.harm_description: sheep died in same manner as goat
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refused to loan her a mallet

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost animals every time refused her something
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Every time they refused her something

harms_catalog.harm_description: pig died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Lent her horses, then asked for loan of her horses, she refused

harms_catalog.harm_description: ox became strangely ill, died in a week
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Took her son into service but sent him home as unsuitable

harms_catalog.harm_description: pig killed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Master wanted her to kill Henry but she refused, only killed his pig
harms_catalog.method_alleged: confessed - devil wanted her to kill Henry himself

harms_catalog.harm_description: fields damaged by hail
hen died when she tested powder
harms_catalog.method_alleged: tried powder given by devil on hen (confession)

material_culture.context: She asked his wife for some cheese
Asked for milk at house of Jean Colas de Vic
Asked for a plate of soup at house of Clement Masson
Asked for loan of horse-comb from Jean Jacquot Henry
Devil gave her white powder in paper to kill men and animals
Master gave her grease to put on broom for traveling to sabbat
Put grease between legs on broom to travel to sabbat through chimney
Wife of Clement Masson said she had lost a dress taken to have dyed black

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial and residence
Location of many witnesses and events
Origin of accused; driven out in belief she was a witch
Location of Chapter court and procureur
Location of witness Didier de la Levee
Location of Claudon Colas Claude Jardel
Where she worked in service with Humbert Herquel
Destination mentioned when asking to borrow horses
Fields damaged by hail she made at sabbat
Where she went to collect wood; where she met devil; where Valencin Connemant died
Location of gruyer who received complaint about wood cutting
Location of accomplice Agatte femme Claude Orbain
Location of accomplices Mengeon Claudey Ferry and wife
Location of accomplice Colas de la Senec le vieux

economic_hardship_indicators: Frequently asked neighbors to borrow necessities
Disputed over amount of wood cut and paid for
Sought to borrow horses for ploughing

officials_named.name: Procureur for Chapter of St Dié

prior_legal_disputes.description: Claudon Jacot Henry called her witch and said she had bewitched her husband to marry her; they went to court
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Only Henry was obliged to make reparation, but he was angry and threatened to kill her

legal_context.redress_outcome: Only accuser obliged to make reparation

hearsay_chains.content: Had often heard that she was driven out of Plumieres in belief she was a witch, and that mother was also suspected
Already generally reputed witch, 'et disoit on communement qu'elle avoit faict mourir son marit'
general reputation, and belief she had killed husband - sought no reparation when accused of this in public

emotional_state_notes: Said witnesses 'had lied like thieves and bad men'
Told relative she was thinking of leaving because of suspicions

third_parties.name: Anthoine Claudel
third_parties.context: Jean Colas de Vic told him to tell Françatte she had bewitched ox and had better cure it

third_parties.name: Valencin Connemant
third_parties.context: Reported her to gruyer for cutting more wood than paid for; died after she threatened him

third_parties.name: Humbert Herquel
third_parties.context: She worked in his service at Plainfain for 4 years

third_parties.name: Ferry Jean Ferry
third_parties.context: She worked in his service at Clemecey for 5 years

third_parties.name: Clement Masson
third_parties.context: His child became ill and lost use of hand after Françatte was refused soup at his house

third_parties.name: wife of Clement Masson
third_parties.context: Dispute over lost dress taken to be dyed black

third_parties.name: Claudon Jacot Henry
third_parties.context: Called her witch and said she had 'enfanté son marit pour l'avoir en mariage'; court case where he had to make reparation

economic_context.details: Dispute over amount of wood cut versus paid for, reported to gruyer of Fraisse. Multiple witnesses note pattern of her asking to borrow necessities and items (cheese, milk, soup, horses, tools), suggesting economic hardship. Had procureurs managing her affairs and children's property.

extraction_metadata.notes: Well-documented trial with 26 witnesses and detailed confession under torture. Pattern of alleged maleficia following refusals of requests for food and items. Economic hardship evident. Change de Nancy consulted and approved both torture and death sentence.
